Posts.Content: On Mar 08, 2010 7:24 AM tommy44 wrote: Hi! I am usually not one to sign up for sites like this. I am age 51 , male. Had male breast cancer 2 1/2 years ago. Partner left me because he hated looking at my scars. Dr. does not acknowledge post-mastectomy pain syndrome or chemo-brain. Lost my health insurance. Nobody around me understands that I freeze a lot after chemo and I found a new lump that i hope is just a fat glob.  I am crying daily and cannot find any support. I feel alone. hi, I just read what you wrote and I am so sorry that has happen to you. I am also sorry your partner has left you and you feel like you are alone. but you are not. you have people out there that look up to you and you dont even know it. you are a surviver.  Alot of people dont know that man get breast cancer. I am opening up a non profit orginazation so people can know and relize what is going on... you have brought tears in my eyse you are the first male brest cancer surviver I have meet. Please if you need anything or any kind of support let me know . my e mail address is --Message edited by CancerCompass staff. For personal protection, email address removed. Consider private reply. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html-- . please feel free to contect me anytime. I know a few women that have husbands couldnt win the fight of cancer. I am sure they will be willing to help as well.
Posts.Title: Male Breast Cancer. 2 years since surgery. Do not have support
